metadata.code: National Building Code of Canada 2023 - Alberta Edition

requirements.description: This Section applies to vapour barriers for buildings
requirements.exact_quote: This Section applies to vapour barriers for buildings

requirements.description: A vapour barrier shall be installed on the warm side of thermal insulation in assemblies separating conditioned from unconditioned spaces
requirements.exact_quote: A vapour barrier shall be installed on the warm side of thermal insulation in assemblies separating conditioned from unconditioned spaces

requirements.description: Maximum water vapour permeance for vapour barrier materials (Type 1)
requirements.exact_quote: Vapour barrier materials shall have a water vapour permeance of not more than 60 ng/(Pa*s*m2)

requirements.description: Maximum water vapour permeance for vapour retarder materials (Type 2)
requirements.exact_quote: Type 2 vapour retarders shall have a permeance of not more than 170 ng/(Pa*s*m2)

requirements.description: Minimum thickness for polyethylene vapour barriers
requirements.exact_quote: Polyethylene vapour barriers shall be not less than 0.15 mm thick

requirements.description: Polyethylene vapour barriers shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M
requirements.exact_quote: Polyethylene vapour barriers shall conform to CAN/CGSB-51.34-M

requirements.description: Aluminum foil not less than 0.025 mm thick may be used as a vapour barrier
requirements.exact_quote: Aluminum foil not less than 0.025 mm thick may be used as a vapour barrier

requirements.description: Minimum thickness for aluminum foil vapour barrier
requirements.exact_quote: Aluminum foil not less than 0.025 mm thick

requirements.description: Vapour barrier paint may be used where it provides equivalent vapour resistance
requirements.exact_quote: Vapour barrier paint may be used where it provides equivalent vapour resistance

requirements.description: Vapour barriers shall be located on the warm side of insulation where the ratio of thermal resistance between the vapour barrier and the exterior is appropriate
requirements.exact_quote: Vapour barriers shall be located on the warm side of insulation

requirements.description: Not more than one-third of the total thermal resistance of the assembly shall be on the warm side of the vapour barrier
requirements.exact_quote: Not more than one-third of the total thermal resistance of the assembly shall be on the warm side of the vapour barrier

requirements.description: Minimum lap for vapour barrier joints
requirements.exact_quote: Joints in vapour barriers shall be lapped not less than 100 mm

requirements.description: Joints in vapour barriers shall occur over framing members or be sealed
requirements.exact_quote: Joints in vapour barriers shall occur over framing members or be sealed with tape or acoustical sealant

requirements.description: Penetrations through vapour barriers shall be sealed to maintain vapour barrier continuity
requirements.exact_quote: Penetrations through vapour barriers shall be sealed to maintain vapour barrier continuity

requirements.description: Vapour barriers shall be continuous across floor assemblies that interrupt wall assemblies
requirements.exact_quote: Vapour barriers shall be continuous across floor assemblies that interrupt wall assemblies

requirements.description: Where basement walls are insulated on the interior, a vapour barrier shall be installed on the warm side of the insulation
requirements.exact_quote: Where basement walls are insulated on the interior, a vapour barrier shall be installed on the warm side of the insulation

requirements.description: A vapour barrier shall be installed under concrete floor slabs in basements
requirements.exact_quote: A vapour barrier shall be installed under concrete floor slabs in basements
